physical_appearance:This is a document certifying honourable discharge from Force 136. The title is printed at the top-center of the document. Below it
 there is a signature in blue ink on the left
 with a portrait photograph on the right. The date and signature is printed at the bottom. There is a \u0027Force 136\u0027 stamp on the top right of the document. The document is faded at some partts
 and has a crease along the middle.

sgcool_label_text:This certificate  belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n\r\nThis drawing is Tan’s rendition of the three leaders (from right) Adolf Hitler
 the Japanese emperor
 Hirohito and Benito Mussolini.

Below it, there is a signature in blue ink on the left, with a portrait photograph on the right. The date and signature is printed at the bottom. There is a 'Force 136' stamp on the top right of the document. The document is faded at some partts, and has a crease along the middle.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This certificate  belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.

This drawing is Tan’s rendition of the three leaders (from right) Adolf Hitler, the Japanese emperor, Hirohito and Benito Mussolini.
